DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Leukocyte Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a medical procedure has been performed that involves testing a sample of blood for a leukocyte, a blood cell that does not contain hemoglobin and are made by bone marrow and help the body fight infection and other diseases as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for a leukocyte, a blood cell that does not contain hemoglobin and are made by bone marrow and help the body fight infection and other diseases as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: White blood cells. These include granular leukocytes (BASOPHILS, EOSINOPHILS, and NEUTROPHILS) as well as non-granular leukocytes (LYMPHOCYTES and MONOCYTES).:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Blood cells that are devoid of hemoglobin, capable of ameboid motion and phagocytosis, and act as the principal components of the immune system.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 2,500/mcL, within 2 weeks of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count more than or equal to 2,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study leukocyte count
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 3,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is WBC greater than 30,000 prior to start of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count more than or equal to 1,500/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count more than or equal to 2,500/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is total white blood cell (WBC) count less than 25 x 10^9/L prior to first dose of decitabine on trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell count (WBC) greater than 3 x 10^9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell count (WBC) greater than or equal to 2,000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 2,000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell count (WBC) greater than or equal to 3 x 10e9/L within 28 days prior to administration of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 2,500/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell count (WBC) greater than or equal to 3 x 10^9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 3.0 x 10^9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 2,500/mcL, unless there is documented bone marrow involvement by lymphoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is screening visit leukocyte count greater than or equal to 2,500/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 1,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell count (WBC) less than or equal to 25 x 10^9 cells /L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell count (WBC) greater than or equal to 2000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is white blood cell (WBC) count less than 50,000/uL prior to Decitabine administration on cycle 1 day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study white blood cell (WBC) count less than 25 x10e9/L prior to start of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 3,000/mcL, within 8 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to institutional lower limit of normal (LLN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 4,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study WBC less than or equal to 25,000 at time of Day 1 of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study leukocytes greater than or equal to 3000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 750/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study WBC less than 25,000 (may be reduced with leukapheresis or hydroxyurea prior to study start)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 3.0 K/cumm within 14 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocytes count greater than or equal to 1,500/mcL unless documented bone marrow involvement in which case lower values may be allowed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than 2,000/mcL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is WBC less than 10,000/mm3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is white blood cell (WBC) count less than or equal 25,000/uL prior to Decitabine administration on cycle 1 day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study WBC less than 25x10e9/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study leukocyte count greater than or equal to 2,000/mcL?
